alert.note: Alert for Calloway; Graves; Marshall (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 03 at 12:26AM EDT until May 03 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Calloway County in western Kentucky... Southern Marshall County in western Kentucky... Graves County in western Kentucky... * Until midnight CDT. * At 1125 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Lovelaceville to near Mayfield to near Sedalia to near Martin, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Mayfield and Sedalia around 1130 PM CDT. Lynnville around 1145 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Benton and Murray. This includes Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 14 and 44. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
